title: definevalue
author: definevalue
content: Wondering if anyone is interested in collab on building a service like this. I found some off the shelf ready to go open sourced table to where users can upload this as a "NFT" have it graded by a DAO just been a hobby of mine and really just don't get motivated unless i'm working with someone. Anyways if you like TCG and sports cards and also into blockchain an want to start selling some grading services would love hearing the feedback.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: definevalue on July 18, 2023, 02:40:08 PMWell everything is built ontop of already open sourced technology and doing a ethereum Proof-of-Authority fork but in order to do this and make it proper I need some nodes or 'board-members' to hop on board who are familiar with hosting. `What exactly are the roles of blockchain here? To make it challenging to modify the data? Maybe you can post more details on how the platform will generally work so potential customers can also learn about it. If I'm not reading it wrong, the card grading service helps people judge the value of a collection and help potential buyers to confirm if the collection is fake or not (plus its quality). Do correct me if I'm wrong. As long as it doesn't involve any new tokens you'd probably see some demand here and there.

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: Quote from: definevalue on June 03, 2023, 12:58:44 AMWondering if anyone is interested in collab on building a service like this. I found some off the shelf ready to go open sourced table to where users can upload this as a "NFT" have it graded by a DAO just been a hobby of mine and really just don't get motivated unless i'm working with someone. Anyways if you like TCG and sports cards and also into blockchain an want to start selling some grading services would love hearing the feedback.So basically the system you want to build is like that offered by PSACard, but supported using blockchain technology and later controlled by DAO? this is an interesting concept.but a few things to note. You are here using DAO which means that anyone who buys your token will be able to participate in voting? or only professionals can participate in evaluating the card? because as far as I know the scoring system for cards is usually done by professionals. And what about the system? usually card assessment is done centrally, but here you use a decentralized system, meaning you have to have criteria for members who want to do an assessment right, how do you manage that?it's good if you can provide a little enlightenment about the project you want to build, so people will understand this project better and maybe someone will be interested in building this project with you.
